metadata.title: CVE-2019-0205 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In Apache Thrift all versions up to and including 0.12.0, a server orclient may run into an endless loop when feed with specific input data.Because the issue had already been partially fixed in version 0.11.0,depending on the installed version it affects only certain languagebindings.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libthrift-0.13.0 - 0.13.0-2build1
libthrift-c-glib0 - 0.13.0-2build1
libthrift-perl - 0.13.0-2build1
php-thrift - 0.13.0-2build1
python3-thrift - 0.13.0-2build1
thrift-compiler - 0.13.0-2build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thrift package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.13.0-2build1').
